SEARCH
Package msoe.swe2721.lab4_5.provided

Class InventoryItem

java.lang.Object
msoe.swe2721.lab4_5.provided.InventoryItem
public class InventoryItem extends Object
This class will keep track of the inventory for a given item in the store.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryItem

      public InventoryItem(String name, String description, int itemNumber, int initialInventory, Money price) throws InvalidParameterException
      This method will instantiate a new inventory item.
      Parameters:
      name - This is the name of the item. Must be at least 2 characters in length.
      description - This is the description of the item. Can be blank, but must not be null.
      itemNumber - This is the item number for the item. It should be unique, though this constructor does not verify that. It must be positive and not zero.
      initialInventory - This is the initial inventory. Must be positive.
      price - This is the price. Must be positive.
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - This will be thrown if any parameter is invalid.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Obtain the name of the stock item.
      Returns:
      The name.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Obtain the description for the given item.
      Returns:
      The description of the item.

    • getItemNumber

      public int getItemNumber()
      Return the number for the given item.
      Returns:
      The number for the given item will be returned.

    • getStockCount

      public int getStockCount()
      The stock count for the given item will be returned.
      Returns:
      The stock count.

    • getPrice

      public Money getPrice()
      Return the price for the given item.
      Returns:
      The price for the given item will be returned.

    • addStock

      public void addStock(int newStock) throws InvalidParameterException
      This method will add stock for the given item.
      Parameters:
      newStock - This is the stock that is to be added.
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - This exception will be thrown if the stock is negative.

    • sellStock

      public int sellStock(int count) throws InvalidParameterException
      This method will sell stock in a given item.
      Parameters:
      count - This is the number of items that are to be sold.
      Returns:
      The return will be the count that were sold. If for some reason the entire requested amount can not be fulfilled, this return will be less than the count requested.
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterException - This exception will be thrown if the number of items ordered is negative.
